intro: Xiphotheca phylicoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved xiphotheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
